name: HUNTS - Screensaver (T1546.002)
description: Hunts for use of Windows Screensaver to enable attacker persistence. Hunts for abnormal screensaver executions, processes spawned by a screensaver, and abnormal modifications to screensaver registry keys.

steps.name: Query for modification of scrnsave_exe registry key using reg_exe

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=1 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} (Image="C:\\Windows\\System32\\reg.exe" OR Image="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\reg.exe") AND (CommandLine="reg*add*\"HKCU\\Control Panel\\Desktop\"*/v*\"SCRNSAVE.EXE\"*" OR CommandLine="reg*add*\"HKEY_CURRENT_USER\\Control Panel\\Desktop\"*/v*\"SCRNSAVE.EXE\"*")   | table host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine ProcessGuid UtcTime EventChannel Computer

steps.name: Copy  of Create and Link Alert2

arguments.comment: SIEM queried for Sysmon logs indicating the scrnsave.exe Registry key was modified via reg.exe on host {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: An attempt to modify the scrnsave.exe Registry key using reg.exe was observed. This is potentially indicative of an adversary establishing persistence by setting the screensaver to execute malware after a user or device has been inactive for a set period of time. The contents of the command line arguments should be evaluated and the host where this command was executed should be investigated for signs of compromise.

steps.name: Copy of Create and Link Alert1

arguments.comment: SIEM queried for Sysmon logs indicating the scrnsave.exe Registry key was modified using Powershell on host {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}.
arguments.description: An attempt to modify the scrnsave.exe Registry key using Powershell was observed. This is potentially indicative of an adversary establishing persistence by setting the screensaver to execute malware after a user or device has been inactive for a set period of time. The contents of the command line arguments should be evaluated and the host where this command was executed should be investigated for signs of compromise.

steps.name: Elastic Query for modification of scrnsave_exe registry key using reg_exe

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:"1" AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND (image_path:C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\reg.exe OR image_path:C\:\\Windows\\System32\\reg.exe) AND (image_path:C\:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\reg.exe OR image_path:C\:\\Windows\\System32\\reg.exe) AND event_data.CommandLine:reg*add\ \"HK*\\Control\ Panel*\\Desktop\"\ \/v*"SCRNSAVE.EXE"*

steps.name: Query for modification of scrnsave_exe registry key using powershell

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=1 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} CommandLine="*New-ItemProperty*-Path*\"HKCU:\\Control Panel\\Desktop\"*-Name*\"SCRNSAVE.EXE\"*" | table host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine ProcessGuid UtcTime EventChannel Computer

steps.name: Elastic Query for modification of scrnsave_exe registry key using powershell

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:"1" AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND event_data.CommandLine:*New-ItemProperty*-Path*\"HKCU\:\\Control\ Panel\\Desktop\"\ -Name\ \"SCRNSAVE.EXE\"*

arguments.comment: SIEM queried for Sysmon logs indicating the scrnsave.exe Registry key was modified via reg.exe on host {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.UtcTime}} and generated Alerts from the search results.
arguments.description: An attempt to modify the scrnsave.exe Registry key using reg.exe was observed. This is potentially indicative of an adversary establishing persistence by setting the screensaver to execute malware after a user or device has been inactive for a set period of time. The contents of the command line arguments should be evaluated and the host where this command was executed should be investigated for signs of compromise.

arguments.comment: SIEM queried for Sysmon logs indicating the scrnsave.exe Registry key was modified using Powershell on host {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.UtcTime}} and generated Alerts from the search results.
arguments.description: An attempt to modify the scrnsave.exe Registry key using Powershell was observed. This is potentially indicative of an adversary establishing persistence by setting the screensaver to execute malware after a user or device has been inactive for a set period of time. The contents of the command line arguments should be evaluated and the host where this command was executed should be investigated for signs of compromise.

steps.name: Elastic Query for scr file executed outside of system32 or syswow64

params.query: event_type:sysmon AND event_id:"1" AND @timestamp:{ {{vars.elasticHuntStart}} TO {{vars.elasticHuntEnd}} } AND image_path:"*.scr" NOT(image_path:"C:\\Windows\\System32\\*" OR image_path:"C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\*")

steps.name: Copy  of Create and Link Alert3

arguments.comment: SIEM queried for Sysmon logs indicating an .scr file was executed from a nonstandard directory on host {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at {{ arrow.get(vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime).timestamp }}.
arguments.description: An attempt to execute a screensaver file (.scr) from a nonstandard directory was observed. Screensaver files are portable executables that are stored in specific directories in a traditional Windows environment. Execution of a .scr file from outside those directories is suspicious and the host that generated this alert should be investigated for signs of compromise.

steps.name: Query for scr file executed outside of system32 or syswow64

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=1 {{vars.splunkHuntStart}} {{vars.splunkHuntEnd}} Image="*.scr" Image!="C:\\Windows\\System32\\*.scr" Image!="C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\*.scr"  | table host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine ProcessGuid UtcTime EventChannel Computer

arguments.comment: SIEM queried for Sysmon logs indicating an .scr file was executed from a nonstandard directory on host {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.UtcTime}} and generated Alerts from the search results.
arguments.description: An attempt to execute a screensaver file (.scr) from a nonstandard directory was observed. Screensaver files are portable executables that are stored in specific directories in a traditional Windows environment. Execution of a .scr file from outside those directories is suspicious and the host that generated this alert should be investigated for signs of compromise.

get results powershell -> Create Splunk Alert
Copy of Create and Link Alert1 -> Copy  of Deduplicate Comments
Select SIEM -> Set Elasticsearch hunt times
